result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darren P. Krueger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darren P. Krueger in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-81, 15CF-66, 15CM-73 and 15CF-117.

1:46 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
15CF-66: State has filed an amended information, amending Count 1 to misdemeanor possession of THC, enhancer. 6 month jail, imposed/stayed, probation for 24 months, AODA and comply, abs sob as to alcohol and controlled substances other than prescribed medications, obt/mtn ft empt, other counseling, pay costs. Defendant will plead to this amended count. Defendant will also plead to Count 2, BAC: .147, 23 day jail sentence, $1,568.00, $33.33, 14 Mo revocation, 14 Mo IID, DOT assessment. Counts 3 and 4 would be dismissed and read in.

15CF-81: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in.
Count 1 and Count 3: 6 mo jail on each, imposed/stayed, concurrent to one another, consecutive to any other sentence, probation 24 months, same conditions, costs, DNA surcharge.  Count 4: 25 day jail sentence consecutive to 15CF-66.

15CM-73: Defendant will plead to single count as charged. State recommends 90 day jail sentence, imposed/stayed, consecutive to any other sentence, probation for 24 months, same general conditions, costs.

15CF-117: State recommends this case be dismissed and read in

Atty Sheets concurs.
Atty Sheets has received a copy of the amended information.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF-66: Count 1 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-66: Count 2 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-81: Count 1 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-81: Count 3 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-81: Count 4 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-73: Count 1 NO CONTEST


Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-66: Count 1: 961.41(3g)(3)   939.62(1)(a)
15CF-66: Count 2: 346.63(1)(a)  Defendant ackknowledges previous conviction
15CF-66: Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-66: Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-81: Count 1: 961.573(1)  939.62(1)(a)
15CF-81: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-81: Count 3: 946.49(1)(a)  939.62(1)(a)
15CF-81: Count 4: 943.44(1)(b)
15CM-73: Count 1:  961.573(1)   939.62(1)(a)
15CF-117: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
$500 cash bond on 15CF-117 to be applied to fines/costs. $500 cash bond in 15CF-81 to be applied to fines/costs.
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant works at Golden County Foods. Atty Sheets requests electronic monitoring.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-66:

Count 1:
Jail sentence for 6 Months, imposed and stayed
Huber is granted.
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations made for treatment
Assessor can make use of any work done in that part. Defendant to sign releases
Maintain absolute sobriety as to alcohol and controlled substances other than prescribed medications
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent reasonable to this case
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2:
Jail sentence for 23 Days
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.
Huber is granted.
Pay a fine and costs totaling $1,568.00
Pay blood draw fee of $33.33
Drivers License Revoked 14 Months
IID 14 Months 
AODA Assessment  and comply with treatment recommendations BAC: .147

15CF-81: 

Count 1:
Jail sentence for 6 Months, imposed and stayed
Huber is granted.
Consecutive to any other sentence
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-66
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 3:
Jail sentence for 6 Months, imposed and stayed
Huber is granted.
Concurrent to Count 1
Consecutive to any other sentence
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and 15CF-66
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 4:
Jail sentence for 25 Days
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.
Huber is granted.
Concurrent to Count 1 and Count 3
Consecutive to OWI but may be on electronic monitor

15CM-73:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 6 months, imposed and stayed
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.
Huber is granted.
Probation for a period of 24 
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-81 and 15CF-66
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

$500 cash bond in 15CF-117 to be applied to fines/costs in the other files.
$500 cash bond in 15CF-81 to be applied to fines/costs.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Darren P. Krueger in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:34 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

PRELIMINARY HEARING:
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

ARRAIGNMENT:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.

Case was pre-tried today.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Arraignment at 04-20-2015 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 04-20-2015 10:30 am.

Defendant Darren P. Krueger in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court enters NOT GUILTY Plea to Count 3. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.
$500 cash bond:  Defendant has until 4:30 p.m. this Friday (03-27-15) to post the $500 cash bond or will need to turn his self back to jail.  Comply with all conditions in all your other bonds.

1:24 p.m. ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jump. (on bond in 15CF66, 15CF81, 15CM73)
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond  with conditions as stated.
BTC: $500 cash bond:  Defednant has until 4:30 p.m. this Friday (03-27-15) to post it or will need to turn his self back to jail.  Comply with all conditions in all your other bonds. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  04-13-2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
